snippet: Four former public officials pleaded guilty Friday to illegally selling information to the Rupert Murdoch-owned tabloid, The Sun.
abstract: Four former public officials in Britain plead guilty to illegally selling information to Rupert Murdoch-owned tabloid The Sun, latest in series of criminal cases stemming from phone-hacking scandal that led to closure of News of the World tabloid.
lead_paragraph: Four former public officials pleaded guilty Friday to illegally selling information to the Rupert Murdoch-owned tabloid, The Sun.

headline.main: Britain: 4 Plead Guilty in Selling Information to Tabloids
headline.print_headline: Britain: 4 Plead Guilty in Selling Information to Tabloids

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
